Position Summary: The IS Network Engineer (ISNE) is responsible for implementing, administering, and troubleshooting of the hospital network infrastructure. In this capacity, the INE will be responsible for administration and troubleshooting of Citrix Netscaler and Cisco products to include program routers, switches and other network hardware. Additional duties include managing, monitoring, and administering datacenter systems, configure DNS Servers, schedule updates/upgrades and assisting with security strategies for the organization. The ISNE will work with the CMC-IS leadership team to ensure all work is approved, understood, communicated, and executed in a professional manner. He/she will work to ensure that the delivery of services meets or exceeds user needs, and is in line with Hospital and IS Policy, and is delivered in a timely manner. The ISNE must be able to understand and communicate technical terminology to a varied audience in laymen’s terms. Qualifications Education: OR AND Experience: Experience with Cisco and Citrix Netscaler network devices Experience with various network types including LANs, WANs, WLANs, SANs, and VoIP networks Solid understanding of Windows Server environments and networking Prior experience as a database architect and/or software developer in the health care arena preferred Licensure/Certification/Registration: Certifications preferred: Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA), Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP), Microsoft Certified Solutions Expert (MCSE), Microsoft Certified Solutions Associate (MCSA), CompTIA Network+ Special Skills: Ability to work effectively and collaboratively with nursing colleagues, physicians, department heads, and members of executive leadership required. Demonstrated proficiency with Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, Explorer and PowerPoint required. Demonstrated proficiency with implementing, administering, and troubleshooting of hospital network infrastructures Exemplary core customer service skills strongly required. Strong organizational skills required. Strong verbal and written communication skills required. Knowledge of program development and administration preferred. Working Conditions: Stress level high due to multiple demands frequently occurring simultaneously. Physical surroundings generally pleasant and comfortable. Generally contained office type environment. Prolonged standing and walking.

Network Engineer Job Description We are looking for a Network Engineer who will be responsible for maintaining and administering our company's computer networks. Your primary duties will include maintenance of computer networks, hardware, software, and other related systems, performing disaster recovery operations, protecting data, software, and hardware from attacks, and replacing faulty network hardware components when necessary. You will also be working closely with the users of our network in order to identify potential issues and fix existing problems. To be a successful candidate, you will need to have a strong understanding of network infrastructure and network hardware. You will also need to be able to implement, administer, and troubleshoot network devices including WAPs, firewalls, routers, switches, IPS, WIPS, WAN accelerator and controllers. A deep knowledge of application transport and network infrastructure protocols is highly desired. Responsibilities: Maintaining and administering computer networks and related computing environments including systems software, applications software, hardware, and configurations. Protecting data, software, and hardware by coordinating, planning and implementing network security measures. Troubleshooting, diagnosing and resolving hardware, software, and other network and system problems. Replacing faulty network hardware components when required. Monitoring network performance to determine if adjustments need to be made. Conferring with network users about solving existing system problems. Operating master consoles to monitor the performance of networks and computer systems. Coordinating computer network access and use Requirements: 5 years IT operations and engineering experience Strong understanding of networking and virtualization technologies Switching and Routing experience in an enterprise data center environment 5+ years Firewall experience in an enterprise data center environment 2+ years Ability to adapt quickly to changing technology requirements Strong system design background Strong communication, presentation, and documentation skills Able to navigate fast-paced and rapidly evolving environments Preferred Technical and Professional Expertise CheckPoint Firewalls VMware NSX Cisco Nexus Switches Trendmicro TippingPoint IPS Cisco ASA Firewall / VPN Steelhead WAN Accelerator Cisco Unified Collaboration Cisco MSE and AP

We are a diverse team of collaborators, doers, and problem-solvers who are relentlessly committed to a culture of safety. We are hoping you will join us in the effort of lowering the cost of access to space and enabling Blue Origin’s vision of millions of people living and working in space to benefit Earth. As part of a hardworking team of diverse engineers, you will be responsible for design and analysis projects supporting New Shepard’s fluids subsystems. On New Shepard, fluids engineers support a broad range of applications including low pressure environmental control systems, high pressure pneumatics, and cryogenic liquids. You will share in the team’s impact on all aspects of pressurized system design, analysis, build, test, and flight operations for the reusable New Shepard spacecraft. This position will directly impact the history of space exploration and will require your dedicated commitment and detailed attention towards safe and repeatable spaceflight. Our best team members are flexible in constantly evolving environments, thorough, detail oriented and passionate. We are looking for someone to apply their technical expertise, leadership skills, and dedication to quality to positively impact safe human spaceflight. Passion for our mission and vision is required! The New Shepard team is headquartered in Kent, WA but we are actively building small teams in several of our remote office locations including Los Angeles, Denver, Huntsville, Reston (Virginia), and Phoenix. Hiring preference will be given to folks who are willing to relocate to Kent, but applicants for our remote locations will absolutely be considered! Responsibilities: Participate in the entire design cycle, including requirements derivation, conceptual and detailed design, system performance modeling, structural analysis, manufacturing and integration support, development testing and qualification. Design and route individual fluid subsystems (i.e., propellant feed, pressurization, pneumatics, reaction control) including procurement, integration support, and discrepancy resolution. Design fluid component groups (i.e., solenoid valves, regulators, pressure vessels) including specification, procurement, processing, and discrepancy resolution of specific components. Perform stress analysis of fluid subsystems including hand calculations and FEA. Identify and implement design changes to improve system reliability, operational cost, and fight cadence. Participate in component and subsystem level testing including planning, execution, data reduction, and analysis. Participate in verification audits of existing components and subsystems. Perform Failure Modes and Effects Criticality Analysis and requirements verification. Develop project development plans, schedules and cost estimates. Coach, mentor and technically assist other engineers and team members. Qualifications: Passion for all things fluids/pneumatic, problem solving, and getting the job done. Who We Are Williams International is a privately-owned company that develops and manufactures jet engines for both military and commercial aircraft applications. We are a company of creators who deliver pioneering ideas and technologies that lead the aerospace industry. Our culture fosters creativity, collaboration, and continuous learning to position our team members to inspire each other and provide quality products and supporting services that exceed the expectations of our customers. The Opportunity Williams International has an exciting opportunity for a Systems Engineer to join our team. The Systems Engineer will be responsible for leading projects to design control systems for aerospace and military applications such as engine controls, motor controls, power converters, and actuators. This is an exciting opportunity to work on high tech, cutting edge products and have a high degree of ownership of your designs. The Systems Engineer will be responsible for: Decomposing high level requirements into control system requirements. Performing trade studies to determine the best control system architecture. Designing and developing new control algorithms for engine control, power electronics, and electric machines. Creating and using models to develop and test control algorithms. Developing algorithms for diagnostics and prognostics. Developing requirements for electrical and mechanical components of the control system (i.e. actuator requirements, sensor accuracy, etc.) Performing control system stability analysis. Working with software and test engineers to implement and verify the control algorithms. Supporting testing including analysis of control system test results. Other duties as assigned. Qualifications Bachelor’s degree in engineering with a controls focus is required with at least 3 years of relevant engineering experience. Knowledge and experience with control systems for engine control, power electronics, and/or electric machines. Experience with MATLAB/Simulink or equivalent software. The ability to model system and sub-system dynamics and create robust control designs. Experience with military, aerospace, automotive, and/or high reliability systems. The ability to work independently and be able to manage multiple projects. Knowledge of microcontrollers (NXP/Freescale is preferred) A basic understanding of the design of power electronics and electric machines. Proficiency in one or more programing languages (C/C++ is preferred). US. Citizenship status required. Position requires the ability to obtain a U.S. Government Security Clearance, if needed. Candidates selected may be subject to a U.S. Government security investigation and must meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information. For more information on Security Clearances, please visit: U. S. Department of State Additional Information Williams International is a Drug Free Workplace where all new team members and contractors are subject to pre-employment drug testing for the following controlled substances: marijuana, cocaine, PCP, amphetamines, opioids and alcohol as policy dictates. Williams International is committed to equal employment opportunities for all individuals regardless of race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, sexual orientation, national origin, age, disability, and protected veteran status.
